parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Strings </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> An SQF equivalent of C++ [http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/cstdlib/atof/ atof] function. Parses the string, interpreting its content as a floating point number.<br><br>
The command first discards as many whitespace characters as necessary until the first non-whitespace character is found. Then, starting from this character, takes as many characters as possible that are valid following a syntax resembling that of [[Floating_Point_Number#Floating_Point_Literals|floating point literals]], and interprets them as a numerical value. The rest of the string after the last valid character is ignored and has no effect on the behavior of this command.<br><br>
If the first sequence of non-whitespace characters in string does not form a valid floating-point number, or if no such sequence exists because either string is empty or contains only whitespace characters, no conversion is performed and the command returns 0. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[parseNumber]] string </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> string: [[String]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[parseNumber]] boolean <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.49.131731</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> boolean: [[Boolean]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Number]] - 0 if [[false]], 1 if [[true]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_number = [[parseNumber]] "0.125"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>0.125</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_number = [[parseNumber]] "2 abc"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>2</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_number = [[parseNumber]] [[true]]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>1</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[BIS_fnc_parseNumber]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on Aug 28, 2014
<dt class="note">[[User:ffur2007slx2_5|ffur2007slx2_5]]
<dd class="note"> (A3 1.26)It only detects the first occurrence of a number in the string, return 0 by default.
<code>[[parseNumber]] "2s4f"; // 2
[[parseNumber]] "s2f4"; // 0</code>
parse config or code, currently [[BIS_fnc_parseNumber]], occurrence is only limited with number, return -1 by default.
<code>{s3s4f} [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_parseNumber]]; // -1</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
